speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Mr. Heckles.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: How did this happen?

speaker: ['Mr. Treeger']
transcript: He musta been sweepin'. They found a broom in his hand.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: That's terrible.

speaker: ['Mr. Treeger']
transcript: I know. I was sweepin' yesterday. It coulda been me.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Sure, sweepin'. You never know.

speaker: ['Mr. Treeger']
transcript: You never know.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, it's very faint, but I can still sense him in the building. Go into the light, Mr. Heckles!

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Ok, Phoebe.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: I'm sorry, but sometimes they need help. That's fine. Go ahead and scoff. You know, there're a lot of things that I don't believe in, but that doesn't mean they're not true.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Such as?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Like crop circles, or the Bermuda triangle, or evolution?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What, you don't, uh, you don't believe in evolution?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Nah. Not really.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: You don't believe in evolution?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: I don't know, it's just, you know...monkeys, Darwin, you know, it's a, it's a nice story, I just think it's a little too easy.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Too easy? Too...The process of every living thing on this planet evolving over millions of years from single-celled organisms, too easy?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Yeah, I just don't buy it.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Uh, excuse me. Evolution is not for you to buy, Phoebe. Evolution is scientific fact, like, like, like the air we breathe, like gravity.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, don't get me started on gravity.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: You uh, you don't believe in gravity?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Well, it's not so much that you know, like I don't believe in it, you know, it's just...I don't know, lately I get the feeling that I'm not so much being pulled down as I am being pushed.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Uh-Oh. It's Isaac Newton, and he's pissed.

speaker: ['Mr. Treeger']
transcript: There she is. And over there, that's the other one. This is Mr. Buddy Boyle, Mr. Heckles' attorney. He'd like to talk to you.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: What can we do for you?

speaker: ['Buddy Boyles']
transcript: All right, kids. Here's the deal. According to my client's will, he wants to leave all his earthly possessions to "the noisy girls in the apartment above mine".

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Well, what about his family?

speaker: ['Buddy Boyles']
transcript: He didn't have any.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Ok, so let's talk money.

speaker: ['Buddy Boyles']
transcript: All right, there was none. Let's talk signing. You be noisy girl number one, you be noisy girl number two.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: How can you not believe in evolution?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Just don't. Look at this funky shirt!

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Pheebs, I have studied evolution my entire adult life. Ok, I can tell you, we have collected fossils from all over the world that actually show the evolution of different species, ok? You can literally see them evolving through time.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Really? You can actually see it?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: You bet. In the U.S., China, Africa, all over.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: See, I didn't know that.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Well, there you go.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Huh. So now, the real question is, who put those fossils there, and why?

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Hey, look at this. "My Big Book of Grievances."

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Hey, there's me! April 17th. Excessive noise. Italian guy comes homes with a date. Hey Chandler, look, you're in here too.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: April 18th, excessive noise. Italian guy's gay roommate comes home with the dry-cleaning. Well that's excellent.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Monica, Monica, look at this lamp. Is this tacky or what? We have to have this.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Rache, I think we have enough regular lamps.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: What? Come on, it's not like I'm asking for this girly clock or anything, which, by the way, I also think is very cool.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: It doesn't go with any of my stuff.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Well, what about my stuff?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: You don't have any stuff.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: You still think of it as your apartment, don't you?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: No.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Yes you do. You think of it as your apartment, and I'm just somebody who rents a room.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Mmmmm.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Ok, while you "mmm" on it for awhile, I'm gonna go find a place for my new lamp.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Ok, Pheebs. See how I'm making these little toys move? Opposable thumbs. Without evolution, how do you explain opposable thumbs?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Maybe the overlords needed them to steer their spacecrafts.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Please tell me you're joking.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Look, can't we just say that you believe in something, and I don't.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: No, no, Pheebs, we can't, ok, because--

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: What is this obsessive need you have to make everyone agree with you? No, what's that all about? I think, I think maybe it's time you put Ross under the microscope.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Is there blood coming out of my ears?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Hey, Rache. You know what we haven't played in a while?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: What?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Hide the Lamp.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Monica, let it go.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Did you know I was allergic to shellfish?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Well, then, you'll just have to eat the other lamps.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Uh-oh. It's Scary Scientist Man.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Ok, Phoebe, this is it. In this briefcase I carry actual scientific facts. A briefcase of facts, if you will. Some of these fossils are over 200 million years old.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, look, before you even start, I'm not denying evolution, ok, I'm just saying that it's one of the possibilities.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: It's the only possibility, Phoebe.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, Ross, could you just open your mind like this much, ok? Wasn't there a time when the brightest minds in the world believed that the world was flat? And, up until like what, 50 years ago, you all thought the atom was the smallest thing, until you split it open, and this like, whole mess of crap came out. Now, are you telling me that you are so unbelievably arrogant that you can't admit that there's a teeny tiny possibility that you could be wrong about this?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: There might be, a teeny, tiny, possibility.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: I can't believe you caved.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: What?

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: You just abandoned your whole belief system. I mean, before, I didn't agree with you, but at least I respected you. How, how, how are you going to go into work tomorrow? How, how are you going to face the other science guys? How, how are you going to face yourself? Oh! That was fun. So who's hungry?
